page.title: 03Ickwell
page.content: Ickwell is a small village about 3 miles west of Biggleswade,often described as looking like the ideal village.It has a wide green with a cricket pitch in the middle and an old oak tree with a wooden seat under it.There is a maypole on the green where annual May Day celebrations, dating from the 16th century take place. Cottages and other residences circle the green.Some of them have thatched roofs and nearly all have neat gates and well kept gardens.A speciality of these buildings is "Ickwell peach",the colour that they are painted.It is a mixture of orange and yellow but not all cottages are the exact shade.Many of the cottages have in the past had to do without plumbing and lavatories.
